headline: L3Harris sells 60% stake in space propulsion business for $845 million
summary: L3Harris Technologies said on Monday it will sell an ​about 60% stake in its space ‌propulsion and power systems business to private equity ‌firm AE Industrial Partners for $845 million, including debt.  The deal furthers L3Harris' plan to shift its focus away from space and ⁠towards defense ‌capabilities amid an increasingly uncertain global geopolitical environment.  The company will, however, ‍continue to have sole ownership of the RS-25 rocket engine, which is currently used on ​NASA's space launch system for the ‌Artemis program.

content.title: L3Harris sells 60% stake in space propulsion business for $845 million
content.summary: L3Harris Technologies said on Monday it will sell an ​about 60% stake in its space ‌propulsion and power systems business to private equity ‌firm AE Industrial Partners for $845 million, including debt.  The deal furthers L3Harris' plan to shift its focus away from space and ⁠towards defense ‌capabilities amid an increasingly uncertain global geopolitical environment.  The company will, however, ‍continue to have sole ownership of the RS-25 rocket engine, which is currently used on ​NASA's space launch system for the ‌Artemis program.

headline: AE Industrial to Acquire Majority Stake in L3Harris’ Space Propulsion & Power Business – "Rocketdyne"
summary: BOCA RATON, Fla., January 05, 2026--AE Industrial Partners, LP ("AE Industrial"), a private investment firm focused on technologies and services considered critical to aerospace and national and economic security, today announced that it has acquired a controlling interest in the Space Propulsion and Power Systems business of L3Harris Technologies (NYSE: LHX). content.title: AE Industrial to Acquire Majority Stake in L3Harris’ Space Propulsion & Power Business – "Rocketdyne"
content.summary: BOCA RATON, Fla., January 05, 2026--AE Industrial Partners, LP ("AE Industrial"), a private investment firm focused on technologies and services considered critical to aerospace and national and economic security, today announced that it has acquired a controlling interest in the Space Propulsion and Power Systems business of L3Harris Technologies (NYSE: LHX). headline: L3Harris to Sell Majority Stake in Space Propulsion & Power Business to AE Industrial Partners
summary: MELBOURNE, Fla., January 05, 2026--L3Harris Technologies (NYSE: LHX) today announced that AE Industrial Partners ("AE Industrial") has agreed to acquire a controlling interest in L3Harris’ Space Propulsion and Power Systems business at a total enterprise value of $845 million.

content.title: L3Harris to Sell Majority Stake in Space Propulsion & Power Business to AE Industrial Partners
content.summary: MELBOURNE, Fla., January 05, 2026--L3Harris Technologies (NYSE: LHX) today announced that AE Industrial Partners ("AE Industrial") has agreed to acquire a controlling interest in L3Harris’ Space Propulsion and Power Systems business at a total enterprise value of $845 million.

headline: Sidus Space Appoints Aerospace Executive Kelle Wendling to Board of Directors
summary: Sidus Space, Inc. (NASDAQ: SIDU) ("Sidus" or the "Company"), an innovative space and defense technology company, today announced the appointment of accomplished aerospace and defense executive Kelle Wendling to its Board of Directors. Ms. Wendling brings more than three decades of executive leadership and government contracting experience across space systems, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR), and Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) markets.
